alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 23 at 3:28AM MDT until October 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT MDT MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, except 1 to 2 inches in Chama, and locally up to 9 inches above 10,000 feet. Southwest winds gusting as high as 55 mph today, except locally to 60 mph over the high peaks of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHERE...Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to Midnight MDT Monday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
